RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,75 0 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000. Races where entered for $10,000 or Less not considered in Allowances.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHARPZAN settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, began to creep closer in the run to the final turn, launched his bid from just off the rail entering the final turn, angled three wide into the stretch, and closed willingly while being carried five wide in deep stretch to get up in time. BACK SHACK away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, and fought on gamely through the lane while drifting three wide to just miss. MAJESTIC STREET away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of BACK SHACK in the run down the backside and into the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and just failed to last while finishing four wide from between rivals. COUNTERACT bobbled slightly at the start, but recovered quickly and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch, struggled to keep tabs on the pacesetters through the final turn, but finished with late interest two wide in the drive. ROAD CLOSURE settled at the back of the pack while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Back Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Counteract
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sharpzan
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 4w

ENTRY.NAME: Road Closure
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pri ce $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAK TO LIBERTY away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace from just off the rail through the second turn and into the stretch, battled through the final turn from the inside of AZOV SEA, shook clear of that rival entering the lane, and quickly drew clear under confident handling. AZOV SEA broke sharply and pressed the pace into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, held a tracking trip two wide entering the backside, battled for the lead two wide into the final turn, was unable to match strides with the winner entering the lane, but closed three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. CRYPTO MUNNY tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, held a stalking trip in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished from along the inside in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. JOCK TALK was unprepared at the start, and hopped at the start while hitting the side of the gate, trailed well behind the field and was never a factor. ONE FIFTY ONE away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained his position into the backstretch while continuing to save ground, moved up along the inside of BAK TO LIBERTY midway down the backstretch, took up when in tight quarters and clipped heels and unseated his rider. ONE FIFTY ONE was vanned off following the race. Following the running of this race there was a stewards inquiry into both the start, and the incident on the backstretch. After review the stewards deemed that all horses received a fair start, but in regards to the incident on the backstretch the stewards disqualified BAK TO LIBERTY for causing interference to ONE FIFTY ONE, causing that rival to clip heels and fall. BAK TO LIBERTY was unplaced as the horse he was deemed to have interfered with did not finish.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: One Fifty One
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, clipped heels 3/8, fell

ENTRY.NAME: Azov Sea
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: T & G Farm of Kentucky, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Jock Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Crypto Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pri ce $30,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAB SAV away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to set a pressured pace from the inside of SLOOP JOHN B in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the inside in the drive to prevail. ACCORDINGLY broke sharply and tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up for the place late. SLOOP JOHN B away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of CAB SAV entering the lane the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and continued gamely three wide in the drive to just miss the place. LOGICAL AL away well and was taken in hand and allowed to settle towards the back of a compact field entering the stretch the first time, began to gain ground on the leaders in the run to the final turn, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing two wide in the drive. ERLICH settled off the contested early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued with a three wide trip in the run down the backside, raced two out from the rail entering the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Cab Sav
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Logical Al
ENTRY.OWNER: Canoe Pass Stables and MacPherson Craig
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Accordingly
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Erlich
ENTRY.OWNER: Christoff, Gordon and Giesbrecht, Lance B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 17000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAY FANTASTIC away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of PAINT ME LUCKY in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, took the narrowest of advantages into the lane, and held WISELY PLAYED safely at bay late to prove best. WISELY PLAYED away alertly and tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground along the inside, held his position in the run down the backside, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive in a solid effort. PAINT ME LUCKY broke sharply and dueled for the lead one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with STAY FANTASTIC entering the lane, and faded in deep stretch. FORT LANGLEY settled at the back of a compact field while saving ground at the rail entering he stretch the first time, commenced his bid four wide entering the final turn to loom a danger midway through the turn, but was unable to sustain his bid in the drive while finishing four wide.

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Langley
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Paint Me Lucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, late fade

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming, And Starter Races Not Considered For Allowances) (Preference To Horses That Ha ve Not Started For Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SET TO SHINE settled at the back of a compact field while maintaining a stalking trip into the backstretch, rallied smartly four wide entering the final turn, looped the field leaving the turn, and was up in time while finishing four wide in the drive. JUST JIMMY away alertly and raced to a narrow advantage from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of BE QUICK in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, maintained a slim lead into the lane, and gave way grudgingly late in a game effort. BE QUICK broke sharply and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive to garner a share. INFINITE PATIENCE away well, but took off the early pace to tracked the leaders into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, raced under snug restraint at the rail in the run down the backside while awaiting room at the rail, continued from along the rail through the final turn while full of run, but never found a clear path in the lane, following an unlucky trip. SMART LAD tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Infinite Patience
ENTRY.OWNER: Decoursey William and R N H Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, track rail, rallied inside, lacked room, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Just Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Set to Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Be Quick
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1 ,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOLD ARCH broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear lead in the run down the backside, maintained his advantage into the final turn, and was never threatened while proving much the best. SIR BREGOVIC away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and continued on gamely one out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. I'M CORFU settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. AQUITANIA ARRIVAL away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid in the drive while finishing at the rail. FOREIGN PROTOCOL unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to seriously threaten. ANARCHY settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was rider's claim of foul. The rider of SIR BREGOVIC lodged a claim of foul against the rider of BOLD ARCH for alleged interference entering the first turn. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Aquitania Arrival
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Corfu
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Bregovic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Anarchy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrison, John and Kim and Sadler, Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, clear lead, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign Protocol
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REMEMBERTHEALAMO away alertly and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and held THREE DAY BENDER safely at bay to prevail. THREE DAY BENDER broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run to the final turn, was quickly overtaken entering the lane, but finished gamely from along the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. JERSEYS IMAGE settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. SELF SERVING unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the rail entering he final turn, but needed more when called upon. ATOMIC HAZE away well, and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, was called upon soon after entering eh backstretch to keep up, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive. SETTEBELLO tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, but weakened in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Jerseys Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Three Day Bender
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, clear lead, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Self Serving
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Atomic Haze
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Settebello
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened
